tuv.seg: The fundamental laws or rules of the European Union (EU) are set out in the Treaties
Tá bundlíthe nó rialacha Aontas na hEorpa (AE) leagtha síos i gconarthaí
All treaties must be agreed and ratified by the member states
Ní mór do gach ballstát gach conradh a aontú agus a dhaingniú
A treaty is ratified when it becomes part of the law of the member states
Deartar go bhfuil conradh daingnithe nuair atá glactha leis mar chuid de dhlí na mballstát
The most important treaty is the Treaty of Rome, which created the European Economic Community in 1957
Is é Conradh na Róimhe, a chruthaigh an Comhphobal Eacnamaíochta Eorpach i 1957 an conradh is tábhachtaí
Since the Treaty of Rome, there have been a number of treaties agreed and ratified by all the member states;
Ó bhí Conradh na Róimhe ann bhí roinnt conarthaí eile aontaithe agus daingnithe ag na baillstáit uilig;
• The Merger Treaty in 1967, which merged the institutions of the three communities
• Conradh an Chumaisc i 1967 a thug le chéile institiúidí an trí phobail
• The Single European Act in 1986, which provided for completion of the single market
• An Ionstraim Eorpach Aonair i 1986, a chruthaigh an t-aonmhargadh
• The Treaty on European Union (the Maastricht Treaty) in 1992, which provided for political and economic union amongst the member states
• Conradh ar an Aontas Eorpach (Conradh Maastricht) i 1992, a sholáthair aontas eacnamaíoch agus polaitiúil i measc na mballstát
• The Treaty of Amsterdam in 1997, which made some changes to the powers of the institutions of the EU and paved the way for EU enlargement
• Conradh Amstardaim i 1997, a rinneadh roinnt athruithe ar chumhachtaí institiúidí an AE agus a chruthaigh an bealach leis an AE a mhéadú
• The Treaty of Nice 2001 which made further changes to the powers and structures of the institutions to facilitate enlargement
• Conradh Nice sa bhliain 2001 a rinneadh tuilleadh athruithe ar chumhachtaí agus struchtúir na n-institiúidí le cur ar chumas an Aontais é féin a mhéadú
• The Treaty of Lisbon 2007 which came into effect on 1 December 2009 made changes to how decisions are made at EU level
• Conradh Lisbon 2007 a tháinig i bhfeidhm an 1 Nollaig 2009 a rinneadh tuilleadh athruithe ar chinnteoireacht ar leibhéal AE
The Treaty of Lisbon amended the EU's two core treaties, the Treaty on European Union and the Treaty establishing the European Community
Conradh Liospóin leasú dhá phríomhchonradh an AE, an Conradh ar an Aontas Eorpach agus an Chonartha ag bunú an Chomhphobail Eorpaigh
The latter was renamed the Treaty on the Functioning of the European Union
Athainmníodh an dara ceann leis an gConradh ar Fheidhmiú an Aontais Eorpaigh
In addition, several Protocols and Declarations were attached to the Lisbon Treaty
Ina theannta sin, cuireadh roinnt Prótacal agus Dearbhuithe atá i gceangal le Conradh Liospóin
The europa.eu website has more information on the Lisbon Treaty
Tá tuilleadh eolais faoi Chonradh Liospóin ar an láithreán gréasáin europa.eu
Treaties are the primary source of EU law but there are also secondary sources of EU law; the institutions of the EU have the power to make legislation
Is iad na conarthaí príomhfhoinse dlí an AE ach tá fo-fhoinsí eile ann freisin: tá cumhacht reachtaíochta ag institiúidí an AE
This power is shared between the European Commission, the Council of the European Union and the European Parliament
Tá an chumhacht seo roinnte idir Coimisiún na hEorpa, agus Comhairle Aontas na hEorpa agus Parlaimint na hEorpa

Under the European citizens' initiative, one million EU citizens from at least 7 EU countries can call on the European Commission to propose legislation on matters where the EU has competence to legislate

Faoin tionscnamh ó na saoránaigh Eorpacha, is féidir milliún saoránach AE ó ar a laghad 7 tíortha an AE iarraidh ar an gCoimisiún Eorpach reachtaíocht a mholadh maidir le ceisteanna a bhfuil gá inniúlacht ag reachtú
There are different types of secondary legislation:
Tá cineálacha difriúla fo-reachtaíochta ann:
These are laws that apply to everyone including all member states
Is dlíthe iad seo a bhaineann le gach duine, na Ballstáit ar fad san áireamh
Regulations become part of national law and are enforceable in national courts immediately once they come into force
Glactar le Rialacháin mar chuid den dlí náisiúnta agus cuirtear i bhfeidhm iad sna cúirteanna náisiúnta láithreach
They do not need to be brought in by any national legislation
Níl aon ghá le reachtaíocht náisiúnta len iad a thabhairt isteach sa dlí
A Directive is a form of order to member states to implement national legislation to achieve a specific result
Ordú do na Ballstáit í Treoir le reachtaíocht náisiúnta a thabhairt isteach ar mhaithe le toradh faoi leith
It is up to the national governments to decide on the form and method of the legislation necessary to achieve that result
Tá sé suas ag na rialtais náisiúnta cinneadh a dhéanamh cén cineál reachtaíochta a theastaíonn leis an toradh sin a bhaint amach
Usually, a Directive will specify a deadline for the implementation of legislation
Is iondúil go mbeidh dáta leagtha síos i dTreoir leis an reachtaíocht chuí a bheith curtha i bhfeidhm
A decision is addressed to a limited and defined group of persons, e.g., one member state or a corporation
Bíonn cinneadh dírithe ar ghrúpa teoranta nó grúpa faoi leith daoine, mar shampla Ballstát amháin nó corparáid
They are binding upon those to whom they are addressed
Ní mór dóibh siúd lena mbaineann siad cloí leo
These are not binding - they are simply recommendations
Ní gá cloí leo seo – níl iontu ach moltaí
EU legislation is published in the Official Journal of the Community and the date that it comes into effect is stated in the Journal
Déantar reachtaíocht an AE a fhoilsiú in Iris Oifigiúil an Chomhphobail agus bíonn an dáta lena dtagann sé i bhfeidhm luaite freisin san Iris
The Official Journal is published every working day and consists of a number of sections including legislation, information and notices and public tenders
Foilsítear an tIris Oifigiúil gach lá oibre agus tá roinnt rannóga ann ina measc reachtaíocht, eolas agus fógraí agus tairiscintí poiblí
You can search for EU legal texts on the EUR-Lex website
Is féidir leat téacsanna dlíthiúla an AE a chuardach ar shuíomh idirlín EUR-Lex
One of the most important aspects of the European Union is that its legislation is superior to all national legislation
Ceann de na gnéithe is tábhachtaí den Aontas Eorpach go bhfuil a reachtaíocht níos údarásaí ná aon reachtaíocht náisiúnta
This means that European law is supreme
Mar sin tá cumhacht uachtarach ag Dlí na hEorpa
Nothing in our national laws can override or take precedence over an EU law
Ní féidir le tada i mBunreacht na hÉireann ná in aon cheann denár dlíthe náisiúnta dlí na hEorpa a shárú nó tosaíocht a bheith aige ar dhlí na hEorpa
